excerpt: Sophisticated, adults-only restaurant offering locally sourced, seasonal fare & a robust wine list.
detail_description: DINS Santi Taura is an upscale, adults-only restaurant in Palma that prides itself on using locally sourced, seasonal ingredients and offering an extensive selection of wines. The chef, Santi Taura, brings a modern twist to traditional Balearic Island cuisine, taking guests on a culinary journey with his tasting menu.
name: DINS Santi Taura
address: Plaça de Llorenç Villalonga, 4, Distrito Centro, 07001 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Tasting menus of adventurous Mediterranean-inspired cuisine, plus wine pairing, in a sleek space.
detail_description: Located in the heart of Palma's old town at Hotel Convent de la Missio, Marc Fosh Restaurant offers an affordable Michelin-starred dining experience. The restaurant, opened by award-winning British chef Marc Fosh, serves modern Mediterranean cuisine with a focus on seasonal ingredients. Guests can indulge in tasting menus and wine pairings in the sleek and contemporary setting.
name: Marc Fosh Restaurant
address: Carrer de la Missió, 7, Distrito Centro, 07003 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Fashionable venue offering sophisticated Mediterranean-Asian fusion fare & tasting menus.
detail_description: Nestled in a charming, buttery-hued mansion surrounded by lush palm trees, Fera Palma Restaurant is a hidden gem that artfully blends Mediterranean and Asian flavors. This stylish venue invites diners to indulge in the creative culinary masterpieces of Austrian chef Simon Petutschnig. Among the standout dishes is the breathtaking Sea in a Shell, featuring oysters paired with Japanese yuzu and island plankton that releases steam reminiscent of ocean mist when hot water is poured over it.
name: Fera Palma Restaurant
address: C/ de la Concepció, 4, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Daringly presented tapas & mains with a global twist, plus cocktails, in a cool bar setting.
detail_description: Vandal Palma is a trendy dining spot located in the stylish Santa Catalina neighborhood. Despite its edgy graffiti-covered exterior, it offers a sophisticated fine dining experience led by Chef Bernabe Caravotta, who brings his diverse culinary expertise from renowned restaurants around the world. The restaurant surprises guests with an eclectic menu of bold dishes expertly paired with cocktails and wines. The interior features minimalistic yet fun architectural decor, including brick tiles and an open plan kitchen.
name: Vandal Palma
address: Plaça del Progrés, 15, Poniente, 07013 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Stagier Bar is a Michelin-recommended tapas and wine bar located near Hard Rock Cafe in Palma. It stands out as one of the few exceptional and non-touristy tapas bars in the area, with some suggesting that it may soon earn an actual Michelin star for its innovative approach to Spanish and Mallorcan cuisine. The menu pays tribute to renowned chef Ferran Adria with its spheric olives.
name: Stagier Bar
address: Carrer d'Espartero, 11, Poniente, 07014 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Easygoing restaurant with vintage decor serving tapas, grills & traditional dishes.
detail_description: La Rosa Vermuteria & Colmado is a laid-back eatery with a vintage ambiance that offers a variety of tapas, grilled dishes, and traditional fare. While some may find the concept posh for a vermouth place, it provides an opportunity to experience this classic drink in a different setting. The restaurant's decor, featuring vintage Martini signs and an impressive collection of antique seltzer bottles, makes it highly Instagrammable.
name: La Rosa Vermuteria & Colmado
address: Carrer de la Rosa, 5, Distrito Centro, 07003 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Genteel, rustic eatery with a terrace plating creative local fare & sweets, plus a robust wine list.
detail_description: Aromata is a charming rustic restaurant located in Palma, Mallorca. The eatery offers a creative local menu and an extensive wine selection. Housed in an atmospheric historic building with ancient stone arches and a light-filled atrium, the restaurant provides a relaxing ambience with contemporary wood furniture and original stone floors.
name: Aromata
address: Carrer de Ramon y Cajal, 12, 07011 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Refined Balearic dishes, including bouillabaisse, at this decades-old venue with a sea-view terrace.
detail_description: Béns d'Avall Restaurant is a renowned dining spot in Mallorca, situated near Soller on the northeast coast. With a picturesque sea-view terrace, this establishment offers refined Balearic dishes, including bouillabaisse. The restaurant's gastronomic proposal, honored with a Michelin star, showcases traditional cuisine of the Balearic Islands using products from their own garden and applying permaculture techniques.
name: Béns d'Avall Restaurant
address: Carretera de Deià, km.56, 07100 Sóller, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Sophisticated Mediterranean dining room with creative tasting menus & wine pairing.
detail_description: Adrian Quetglas Restaurant in Palma is a favorite among the city's chic food enthusiasts. Owned by Michelin-starred chef Adrian Quetglas, this Mediterranean dining room offers an intimate atmosphere and innovative flavors in its modern dishes. The restaurant features a lunchtime tasting menu and evening options that include unique dishes like Iberian ham with marinated papaya, orzo with squid and yuzu, and Mallorquin ensaimada with matcha tea and chocolate for dessert.
name: Adrian Quetglas Restaurant
address: Pg. de Mallorca, 20, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Refined space for grilled seafood & meat dishes, plus inspired tapas & a global wine list.
detail_description: La Bodeguilla is a sophisticated restaurant in Palma, known for its grilled seafood and meat dishes, as well as an array of tapas and an extensive global wine selection. The restaurant is run by two food-loving brothers and features a grown-up, monochrome space with jamon serrano hanging from the ceiling. The menu highlights island flavors with dishes like suckling pig and scarlet shrimp slick with garlicky aioli.
name: La Bodeguilla
address: Carrer de Sant Jaume, 3, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Stylish eatery in a narrow space with counter seats serving tapas, seafood & meat plates, plus wine.
detail_description: El Camino is a stylish eatery located in Palma, brought to life by the creators of London's popular Barrafina tapas restaurants. Despite opening just before the pandemic, it has become a favorite spot in town. The bistro's modern and welcoming interior attracts passersby, with a daily queue forming outside. The long bar top is always packed as patrons order tapas and watch the chefs work in the open kitchen.
name: El Camino
address: Carrer de Can Brondo, 4, Distrito Centro, 07001 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Nestled in the charming old town of Palma de Mallorca, Toque de Queda is a delightful tapas restaurant that beautifully marries history with culinary tradition. Originally a 15th-century bakery, this cozy spot invites guests to indulge in an array of charcuterie and cheese platters while enjoying cervezas at communal tables. The ambiance is warm and inviting, reminiscent of an old pueblo, enhanced by vintage decor and fairy lights adorning the patio as night falls.
name: Toque de Queda
address: Carrer de Can Cavalleria, 15B, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Restaurant Botànic is a charming and romantic dining spot located in Spain, nestled in the back garden of a 16th-century mansion just off Passeig del Born. The restaurant offers a unique experience with its focus on fresh, plant-forward dishes that are both healthy and indulgent. Chef Andres Benitez creates innovative global fusion dishes using local ingredients, drawing inspiration from various cuisines such as Asian, Middle Eastern, and Mexican.
name: Restaurant Botànic
address: Carrer del Forn de la Glòria, 14, Centre, 07012 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Classy, open-air venue offering a fusion of Mediterranean & Japanese dishes, plus cocktails.
detail_description: Mar de Nudos is a sophisticated open-air restaurant located at Palma's Moll Vell waterfront, offering a fusion of Mediterranean and Japanese cuisine. The chef, Marco di Loreto, has crafted a menu that has become popular among locals who often make reservations days in advance to enjoy the unique blend of Mediterranean and Japanese flavors.
name: Mar de Nudos Mediterranean & Japanese cuisine
address: Carrer del Moll, 6, Local 1, 07012 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: Bar La Sang is a laid-back wine bar located about 20 minutes away from the old town. It offers a variety of raciones and tapas, including tostadas with creamy burrata and anchovies. The natural wine list features selections from small producers around Spain, such as earthy Mallorcan reds and crisp whites from Catalonia. While currently functioning only as a bottle shop due to indoor dining restrictions, it is known for its spectacular selection of natural wines.
name: Bar La Sang
address: Carrer d'Antoni Frontera, 24, Norte, 07004 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Palma de Mallorca, Restaurante Arume is a culinary gem that beautifully marries tradition with innovation. Under the expert guidance of Chef Tomeu Marti, this elegant establishment boasts two locations: one on the bustling C / San Miguel pedestrian street and another within the lively Santa Catalina market. Renowned for its spectacular tasting menu that refreshes every two months, Arume also offers delightful daily menus perfect for lunch alongside an enticing à la carte selection.
name: Restaurante Arume
address: Carrer de Sant Miquel, 83, Centre, 07002 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: High-end, multi-course meals with global inspiration served in a classy restaurant.
detail_description: Zaranda is a high-end restaurant located in a chic boutique hotel, known for its multi-course meals with global inspiration. Led by the celebrated Michelin-starred chef Fernando P. Arellano, the restaurant offers dynamic tasting menus filled with colorful, textured, and aromatic dishes such as succulent rock octopus and black egg with white onion and cuttlefish caviar.
name: Zaranda
address: Hotel Es Princep, Carrer de Bala Roja, 1, 07001 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Daily menus featuring seasonal specials in a rustic-chic 19th-century house with countryside views.
detail_description: Located in the charming village of Selva, Miceli is a rustic-chic restaurant set in a 19th-century townhouse with picturesque countryside views. Run by Chef Marga Coll, the Michelin Bib Gourmand-awarded eatery offers daily menus featuring seasonal specials crafted from fresh market produce. The snug and modern dining room, complete with an open kitchen and fragrant terrace, exudes a tranquil atmosphere.
name: Miceli
address: Carrer dels Angels, 11, 07313 Selva, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Located in a former garage, the stylish Brut restaurant boasts its own on-site microbrewery producing craft beers and kombuchas. Owned by Edu Martinez and Bruno Balbi from Argentina, this dining establishment offers a bold and exhilarating culinary experience using fresh island ingredients that change with the seasons. Vibrant and creatively prepared fermented vegetables add flair to each dish, while delectable plates like slow cooked venison with a rich pumpkin sauce leave patrons craving more.
name: Brut restaurant
address: Carrer la Carretera, 37, 07430 Llubí, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Nestled within the lush grounds of the Cap Vermell Grand Hotel, VORO Restaurant is a culinary gem that beckons food enthusiasts from afar. The name itself, derived from the Latin word for "devour," perfectly encapsulates its ethos of savoring every element of a dish. Under the expert guidance of Chef Alvaro Salazar, guests can indulge in two extraordinary tasting menus: Voro with 22 courses and Devoro featuring 17 courses.
name: VORO Restaurant
address: Urb. Atalaya de Canyamel, Vial A2, 12, Mallorca, 07589 Canyamel, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Vendors sell produce, cheese, seafood, pastries & prepared foods in a light-filled historic hall.
detail_description: Mercat de l’Olivar is Palma's largest covered market, conveniently located near the Placa d'Espanya and the main transport hub. The historic hall is filled with vendors selling a variety of goods, from produce and cheese to seafood and pastries. It has been open since the 1950s and offers an array of Balearic cheeses, fresh fruits and vegetables, Spanish olives, island salts, as well as takeaway Mallorcan meals.
name: Mercat de l’Olivar
address: Plaça de l'Olivar, s/n, Centre, 07002 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: Mercat de Santa Catalina is a must-visit undercover food market in the trendy Santa Catalina neighborhood. It's recommended to explore it after sunset, as the area comes alive with its thriving nightlife, featuring trendy bars, clubs, and contemporary restaurants. The market offers a variety of local delicacies such as sobrassada sausage, olive oil, meats, cheeses, wines, and liqueurs. You can also find stalls selling oils, chutneys, honey, and other packaged goods.
name: Mercat de Santa Catalina
address: Plaça de la Navegació, s/n, Ponent, 07013 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Modern Majorcan cuisine & cocktails in a sleek beach club with sun loungers, a pool & sea views.
detail_description: The Mediterranean restaurant Mhares Sea Club has a great atmosphere with sun loungers and views of the sea. It's a great place to relax, with excellent food and cocktails. The only downside was that the kitchen was closed so soon, but overall it was an excellent experience.
name: Mhares Sea Club
address: Carrer de l'Oronella, s/n, 07609, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Intimate spot with a homey vibe serving a flexible menu of North African dishes, with vegan options.
detail_description: A Ma Maison Restaurant, located in Santa Catalina, is a charming and intimate spot with a cozy atmosphere. The menu offers a variety of North African dishes with vegan options available. The restaurant recently celebrated its 9th anniversary and is known for its innovative chef Saloua, who cooks with passion and ensures a personalized experience for guests. A Ma Maison also offers special tasting menus for occasions like Valentine's Day, showcasing flavorful delights such as red tuna tartare.
name: A Ma Maison Restaurant
address: Carrer Soler, 18A, Ponent, 07013 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: Restaurant Andreu Genestra is a culinary gem nestled in Mallorca, where Chef Patron Andreu Genestra collaborates with 14 talented local chefs to create an unforgettable dining experience. The restaurant prides itself on utilizing organic produce from its own garden, including vegetables, fruits, herbs, and even freshly laid eggs. With tasting menus that evolve every quarter, guests can indulge in a multi-course journey or select individual dishes if they prefer a more tailored experience.
name: Restaurant Andreu Genestra
address: Camí de Sa Torre, km8, 7, 07609, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: Tomeu Caldentey Cuiner is a casual restaurant located at the Protur Sa Coma resort, run by Majorcan chef Tomeu Caldentey and his wife Marta. The restaurant offers three affordable tasting menus featuring locally sourced ingredients. Diners can watch Tomeu prepare dishes at a counter in the warm and inviting kitchen-style room.
name: Tomeu Caldentey Cuiner
address: Calle Lilas, s/n, 07560 Sa Coma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Casual bar with terrace seating dishing up classic tapas & pintxos with vegetarian & vegan options.
detail_description: Bar Espanya is a laid-back tapas bar located in the heart of Palma, offering classic tapas and pintxos with options for vegetarians and vegans. The bar provides a casual and unpretentious atmosphere, attracting both tourists and locals of all ages. Visitors can enjoy a wide selection of beers while indulging in national cuisine favorites like crab on toast and cheese with quince tapas.
name: Bar Espanya
address: Carrer de Can Escursac, 12, Centre, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: Fornet de la Soca, formerly known as Forn des Teatre, is a traditional bakery located in Plaza Weyler at the heart of Palma. The bakery prides itself on recreating forgotten local recipes from the turn of the century and offers a beautiful display of Mallorcan products for visitors to take home. The charming premises are housed in a modernist building with rolling shapes and plant motifs as its focal point, adding to its allure.
name: Fornet de la Soca
address: Plaça de Weyler, 9, Distrito Centro, 07001 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Classic regional seafood & meat dishes, plus wine, served in a homey space with a laid-back vibe.
detail_description: Restaurante Casa Maruka offers a laid-back atmosphere and serves classic regional seafood and meat dishes along with wine. It cleverly channels an old-fashioned casa de comidas, offering Spanish dishes with a modern twist. The menu is market-led, featuring fish from SOlivar market cooked to perfection. Notable dishes include the legendary steak tartare and the deliciously crisp tarta de manzana (apple tart).
name: Restaurante Casa Maruka
address: Carrer de la Reina Maria Cristina, 7, Norte, 07004 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Updated Mediterranean dishes & tasting menus in an elegant hotel restaurant with a garden.
detail_description: QUADRAT Restaurant & Garden offers a blend of Mediterranean cuisine and local flavors in an elegant setting at the former stables of Hotel Sant Francesc in Palma. The upscale restaurant features a lovely terrace, making it perfect for charming summer evenings. It is known for its updated Mediterranean dishes and tasting menus, providing a taste of down home Mallorcan cooking.
name: QUADRAT Restaurant & Garden
address: Plaça de Sant Francesc, 5, Patio, Distrito Centro, 07001 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Rustic restaurant with a shady terrace, specializing in traditional pa amb oli, bread with toppings.
detail_description: QuitaPenas Valldemossa is a charming rustic restaurant located in a historic Mallorcan building, offering a genuine taste of tradition. Specializing in Pa amb Oli and other regional dishes, it provides an authentic dining experience. The restaurant also serves as a deli where visitors can sample traditional Mallorquin delicacies. The staff is known for their helpful and kind service, adding to the warm and friendly atmosphere of the place.
name: QuitaPenas Valldemossa
address: Carrer Vell, 4, 07170 Valldemossa, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Venerable, roomy cantina making simple Majorcan meals using locally sourced ingredients.
detail_description: Patrón Lunares is a spacious and venerable cantina in Santa Catalina, Majorca, offering simple local meals made with fresh ingredients. The restaurant's stylish maritime interiors pay homage to the neighborhood's fishing heritage. Specializing in seafood, the menu also features traditional island dishes, grilled meats, and ceviche. A must-try is their signature deconstructed Guacamole served with nachos. The establishment caters to gluten-free diners without compromising on authentic Spanish coastal cuisine.
name: Patrón Lunares
address: C. de la Fàbrica, 30, Ponent, 07013 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Fusion cuisine with Mediterranean, Peruvian & Japanese influences, in a chic venue with 2 terraces.
detail_description: De Tokio a Lima is a chic restaurant located within the Can Alomar boutique hotel, offering a fusion of Mediterranean, Peruvian, and Japanese influences. The elegant venue features two terraces with views of Paseo del Borne, creating an exclusive ambiance for guests. The menu showcases dishes such as Nikkei ceviche and ethereal shrimp fritters with unique flavor combinations.
name: de tokio a lima
address: Carrer de Sant Feliu, 1, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Genteel rooms in a 17th-century hotel with a rustic restaurant, a wine cellar & breakfast.
detail_description: Hotel i Celler Can Font in Sineu, Mallorca offers genteel rooms in a 17th-century setting with a rustic restaurant and wine cellar. The restaurant serves typical Majorcan cuisine surrounded by old winebags and rustic furniture, featuring dishes like Sineus frit, tripe, and tongue with capers. The hotel's central location makes it ideal for exploring Mallorca by car, with easy access to various towns and proximity to Palma.
name: Hotel i Celler Can Font - Restaurante y hotel en Sineu - Mallorca
address: Plaça 18, 07510 Sineu, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Isaan Thai Cuisine offers an authentic taste of Thailand with a team of dedicated Thai chefs preparing Asian dishes in a simple yet elegant setting. The restaurant provides a warm and inviting atmosphere, making diners feel like they've entered a magical world. Guests can choose to sit at the bar overlooking the open kitchen to watch the chefs at work. The menu features delicious starters and mains, all expertly prepared with high-quality ingredients to maximize flavor.
name: Isaan Thai Cuisine
address: Carrer de la Pursiana, 14, Poniente, 07013 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Nestled in a charming rustic village at the foot of the Tramuntana Mountains, Restaurant Ca na Toneta captures the essence of Majorca through its traditional recipes and commitment to farm-to-table principles. Founded by sisters Maria and Teresa Solivellas, this idyllic eatery showcases authentic Majorcan cuisine using ingredients sourced from their own organic garden and local suppliers.
name: Restaurant Ca na Toneta
address: Carrer de s'Horitzó, 21, 07314 Caimari, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Upscale Mediterranean dining in a refined locale with a stone floor & a covered terrace.
detail_description: Restaurant Ca'n Boqueta is a must-visit for anyone seeking an upscale Mediterranean dining experience in the heart of Soller. Nestled within a charming Majorcan house, this restaurant boasts a refined atmosphere with its rustic stone floors and inviting covered terrace. Known for its commitment to high-quality ingredients and seasonal recipes, Ca'n Boqueta offers a unique dining concept that revolves around set menus rather than traditional à la carte options.
name: Restaurant Ca'n Boqueta
address: Gran Via, 43, 07100 Sóller, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Nestled near Palma de Mallorca, Ses Coves de Gènova is a charming restaurant that offers an authentic taste of Mallorcan cuisine. Visitors rave about the seasonal delicacies, particularly the calcots, which are a must-try! The menu features a delightful array of dishes complemented by delectable desserts. The cozy atmosphere makes it an inviting spot to enjoy your meal, and the attentive service from staff like Valentina ensures you feel right at home.
name: Ses Coves de Gènova
address: Carrer del Barranc, 45, Ponent, 07015 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

name: Baiben Restaurant
address: Carrer d'Antoni Maria Alcover, 1, 07181 Portals Nous, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Restaurante Tast Unión is a bustling and popular spot, especially for locals, making it perfect for a quick bite while shopping in the town center. The restaurant offers a variety of pintxos, tapas, and raciones at very reasonable prices. The original location on Carrer de la Unio boasts a trendy yet cozy ambiance with rustic wooden furnishings and high ceilings. It's known for its delicious pintxos like the crispy patatas bravas and camembert frito.
name: Restaurante Tast Unión
address: Carrer Unió, 2, Distrito Centro, 07001 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Casual, long-running restaurant serving traditional tapas, seafood, paella & meat dishes, plus wine.
detail_description: Discover the essence of Mallorcan cuisine at Celler de sa Premsa, a charming restaurant nestled in the heart of Palma. Step into this centuries-old establishment with its rustic ambiance and stone walls, and embark on a culinary journey through traditional tapas, seafood, paella, and meat dishes paired with an exquisite selection of wines. From the classic tumbet to the flavorful cordero a la mallorquina, each dish showcases the rich flavors of Mallorca.
name: Celler de sa Premsa
address: Plaça del Bisbe Berenguer de Palou, 8, Centre, 07003 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Classic Mediterranean fare in a polished environment with coastal-chic decor & marina views.
detail_description: Restaurante El Náutico offers a classic Mediterranean dining experience in a stylish setting with coastal-chic decor and stunning marina views. The restaurant's interior is adorned in the colors of the Mediterranean sea and sky, creating a serene ambiance. The menu features a well-balanced selection of seafood and meat dishes, such as grilled tuna steak and sirloin steak with sautéed foie.
name: Restaurante El Náutico
address: Muelle de San Pedro, s/n, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Andana is a bustling restaurant located in Palma, housed in a charming 19th century railway building near the main bus station. The brainchild of Michelin-starred chef Maca de Castro, it offers a modern take on authentic Majorcan cuisine using fresh local produce. The restaurant is usually busy and has a frenetic atmosphere, so booking in advance is advisable.
name: Andana Restaurant
address: Pl. d'Espanya, 6, Nord, 07002 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Chill locale with outdoor seating fixing up global eats such as burgers, curries & tacos, plus wine.
detail_description: Duke Restaurant is a popular spot in Palma known for its laid-back atmosphere and global cuisine. The restaurant exudes a hippie spirit reminiscent of the Balearics, with a back patio that feels like a suntrap from Venice Beach. The place is adorned with universal symbols like VW camper vans and world maps, creating a common language for the diverse ex-pat community in Santa Catalina.
name: Duke Restaurant
address: Carrer Soler, 36, Poniente, 07013 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Es Celler de Petra is a unique cellar restaurant located in Petra, Spain. It offers an old authentic Mallorcan atmosphere and serves excellent Mallorcan and Spanish cuisine. The restaurant has high ceilings and lots of open space, creating a cozy yet spacious dining experience. Despite the narrow streets outside, the interior surprises with its size and ambiance.
name: Es Celler de Petra
address: Carrer de l'Hospital, 46, 07520 Petra, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Easygoing Mexican restaurant serving tacos, burritos & casseroles, plus cocktails.
detail_description: L'Informal Tacos is a laid-back Mexican eatery offering a variety of tacos, burritos, and casseroles along with cocktails. Nestled away from the hustle and bustle, the restaurant features a relaxed atmosphere both inside and outside, with a play area for kids and shaded seating for parents. The clean and fresh interior provides a comfortable dining experience. The food is described as a treat, with delicious tacos that boast well-balanced flavors.
name: L'Informal Tacos
address: Plaça Nova de la Ferreria, 5, Distrito Centro, 07002 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Palma, Quina Creu Tapas & Restaurant is a chic bistro bar that effortlessly blends sophistication with a cozy ambiance. Its eclectic interior features mismatched furniture and charming bookshelves, creating an inviting atmosphere perfect for any occasion. The menu is refreshingly diverse, changing weekly to showcase delightful starters, vibrant salads, and authentic Spanish main dishes alongside tantalizing tapas.
name: Quina Creu Tapas Restaurante
address: Carrer de la Corderia, 24, Distrito Centro, 07001 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Restaurante Tast Avenidas is a charming restaurant located in the old town of Palma, housed in a nineteenth-century Majorcan manor house. The menu offers traditional dishes and new creations inspired by the Balearic Islands, allowing diners to experience authentic island cuisine. Guests can enjoy tapas from the counter or opt for small hot appetizers like the highly recommended Hot Stone with meat. The service is excellent, and patrons praise the delicious food at reasonable prices.
name: Restaurante Tast Avenidas
address: Avinguda del Comte de Sallent, 13, Distrito Centro, 07003 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: El Perrito is a popular brunch spot located in Santa Catalina, a former fishing district turned into an upscale area in Palma. The cafe has expanded to three locations due to its success. It offers a cozy and welcoming atmosphere where guests can enjoy traditional homemade cooking inspired by cherished family recipes. With its coveted streetside tables, it's the perfect place to start the day with a delicious breakfast while soaking up the local ambiance.
name: El Perrito
address: Carrer d'Anníbal, 20, Poniente, 07013 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Cuit Bar and Restaurant, located in Palma, offers Mediterranean-inspired cuisine with stunning views of the city, including La Seu Cathedral and the Bay of Palma. The restaurant is led by renowned chef Miquel Calent, who focuses on bringing artisanal and seasonal dishes to a global audience while revitalizing traditional Mallorcan recipes.
name: Cuit
address: Hotel Nakar, Av. de Jaume III, 21, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain
